column4: wired i can now ping the modem router but can not connect to the internet
Does the router have DHCP server turned on?
Check the cable? #If the router's DHCP server is turned on, it should have just downloaded IP info.
But you said you could ping the router?  #ping 192.168.1.1  ?
sudo ifconfig eth0 192.168.1.6;route add default gw 192.168.1.1
Try the above commands, let us know.
sudo ifconfig eth0 192.168.1.6;sudo route add default gw 192.168.1.1
Then:  host av.com  #To see if it works.

Does it work?  route -n  #Will tell you if you have 192.168.1.1 as default gateway.  If so, and it still does not work look at /etc/resolv.conf and see what you have there, let us know.    cat /etc/resolv.conf
